ygData.messageBody:
This is a good idea .. thanks :)
Honestly, its so nice you guys are really supportive! I was feeling really
inadequate at barding because I couldn't do this but it seems its really not
necessary! If I play with casters, its easy to keep them happy - just play
mana ALL THE TIME! Haha!

Also, if anyone is bored and wants to share.. what songs were your standards
at 35ish? I usually play iwht a monk or a monk/cleric if that helps...

Tani/Halana

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Stephen E. McCloskey [mailto:s.mccloskey@...]
> Sent: Monday, November 13, 2000 9:57 AM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Twisting Questions
>
>
> I have done this albeit rare, I generally prefer to watch the
> battle over
> staring at the hot boxes. It was usually only where high
> resistances were
> needed, like Kithicor. I was around level 29 or 30 at the
> time so I wasn't
> a battery. It was set up like this:
> Slot 1: Anthem
> Slot 2: Elemental Rythms
> Slot 3: Primary hand
> Slot 4: Secondary hand
> Slot 5: Inventory slot
> Slot 6: Inventory slot
>
> Depending on how fast you get you can do it like this: While
> moving the
> primary weapon out of the primary slot start up your
> instrument song, drop
> the primary weapon on the drum in the inventory then drop the
> drum on the
> secondary weapon. Keep the secondary weapon in your cursor,
> don't put it
> in the inventory. Once it pulses start another song and swap
> the secondary
> weapon and the instrument, drop the instrument on the primary
> weapon and
> equip it. Once you get good at this you can try taking out one of the
> inventory slots in the hot bank and replace it with a third song.
>
> -Steve
>
> At 08:23 AM 11/13/00 -0700, you wrote:
> >Ok, so I hit 35 (yeah!) and am fighting with a monk alt
> whose main is a bard
> >(an awesome one at that) and he's giving me hints here and
> there... "less
> >talking more twisting!"
> >
> >Anyway, he tells me that I should be not only running three
> to four songs
> >but also switching out weapons and instruments while doing this.
> >
> >Do you all actually do this? I tried this and its HELLA hard! So my
> >question is.. do you all actually do this and if so HOW.
> >
> >I have #1 bank set up with 2 melee slots and 4 inventory
> slots, and #2 bank
> >set up with 6 songs... I just can't seem to hit a song,
> switch to #1, switch
> >out weapons for instrument in time to hit #2 and do a new
> song without
> >missing a beat. Am I doing something wrong or is this one
> of those things
> >that just takes practice? And yes, I'm using shift+1 to
> switch hotkey
> >banks...
> >
> >
> >Tani, 35th Bard
> >Halana, 57th Shaman
> >Paradigm
> >Solusek Ro
